items.title: AIXA Miner Advances Scalable Cloud Mining Solutions as Institutional Blockchain Demand Grows
items.summary: AIXA Miner is advancing scalable cloud mining solutions to meet the growing demand from institutional blockchain users, addressing the divide between adoption and accessibility of mining technologies.

items.title: These Stocks Are Skyrocketing and Are Still Solid Long-Term Buys
items.summary: Nvidia and Microsoft stocks are skyrocketing due to AI-related news, with Nvidia resuming chip sales to China and Microsoft benefiting from AI integration. Both companies are seen as solid long-term buys.

items.title: Love, simulated: Why some are turning to AI for romance
items.summary: AI models like Character AI and Replika AI are being used to simulate intimacy and empathy in romantic relationships by utilizing LLMs trained on human conversations, along with voice, facial cues, and memory features.

items.title: When the AI Went Silent: How Dissent Gets Coded — and How to Rewrite It. Prof. Rima Najjar
items.summary: When the AI Went Silent: How Dissent Gets Coded — and How to Rewrite It. Prof. Rima Najjar shared a draft on Georges Abdallah with DeepSeek, an AI system, which generated a bullet-point summary, highlighting the issue of how dissent is coded by AI systems.

items.title: Insta360 responds to GoPro’s patent infringement allegations
items.summary: Insta360 responds to GoPro’s patent infringement allegations by refuting the utility patent claims made by GoPro, after the International Trade Commission ruled that Insta360 infringed on GoPro's HERO camera design patent.

items.title: Grant Cardone Just Explained The Top Mindset Shift That Separates The Rich From Everyone Else
items.summary: Grant Cardone explains the top mindset shift that separates the rich from everyone else, emphasizing the importance of how one thinks about money and wealth accumulation for achieving long-term financial goals.

items.title: Minisforum MS-A2 review: Compact AMD mini PC with workstation ambitions and GPU upgrade option
items.summary: Minisforum MS-A2 is a compact AMD mini PC with workstation ambitions, offering desktop-level performance in a small form factor for tasks like video editing and 3D rendering.

items.summary: This week's Japanese game releases include WUCHANG: Fallen Feathers and No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files, showcasing the use of AI in creating immersive gaming experiences.

items.title: Alphabet’s earnings will probably be fine, analysts say, but it faces this threat to its core business
items.summary: Alphabet faces threat to its core business as AI becomes a main theme in second-quarter earnings. Other companies such as Tesla, Mattel, Hasbro, and Coca-Cola are also reporting earnings, with Trump policies remaining a top concern.

items.title: Airtel-Perplexity deal gives the AI giant an entry into India market
items.summary: Airtel-Perplexity deal gives the AI giant an entry into India market, marking Perplexity's first partnership with an Indian telecom company. Pro offers features like access to models like GPT 4.1 and Claude, deep research and analysis.

items.title: Fuel Distribution & Marketing Industry - USA
items.summary: Sunoco LP, World Kinect Corporation, Global Partners LP, CrossAmerica Partners LP, and ARKO Corp are partnering to implement artificial intelligence technology in the fuel distribution and marketing industry in the USA.

items.title: Middle-class salary a scam? CoinSwitch founder calls out the illusion behind flights, phones, and quiet financial stress
items.summary: Middle-class salaries in India are not keeping up with rising food prices, leading to a decline in purchasing power according to CoinSwitch founder Ashish Singhal.

items.title: Bragar Eagel & Squire, P.C. Urges Investors in UnitedHealth, Bitfarms, or Reddit to Inquire About Their Rights in Class Action Lawsuits
items.summary: Bragar Eagel & Squire, P.C. urges investors in UnitedHealth, Bitfarms, or Reddit to inquire about their rights in class action lawsuits. Litigation Partner Brandon Walker encourages investors who suffered losses in UnitedHealth, Bitfarms, or Reddit to contact him directly to discuss their options.

items.title: AMD's FSR 4 gets a big boost in compatibility as OptiScaler now supports upconverting any modern upscaler to FSR 4 with frame-gen, as long as the game isn't Vulkan-based or has anti-cheat
items.summary: AMD's FSR 4 gains compatibility boost with OptiScaler, allowing for upconversion of modern upscalers to FSR 4 with frame-gen. The mod now supports any game with DLSS 2+ or FSR 2+ as long as it doesn't require Vulkan or an anti-cheat, requiring an RX 9000-series GPU and patience.

items.title: Are Central Banks Ready for AI to Rewrite the Rules of the Economy?
items.summary: Central banks are considering how artificial intelligence will shape the global economy, central banking, and financial forecasting with insight from Larry Summers.

items.title: Fiendish New Mexico sheriff’s deputy fatally throws helpless baby rabbit against side of car: video shows
items.summary: A New Mexico sheriff's deputy has been placed on leave after a video showed him fatally throwing a baby rabbit against the side of his car. The deputy was smiling in the video, sparking concerns about ethical behavior and animal cruelty.

items.title: When is it the best time to post on Show HN?
items.summary: Myriade offers an AI copilot that can transform data into answers and go beyond traditional NL2SQL methods. Users can install and try it for free to enhance their data analysis capabilities.

items.summary: Bragar Eagel & Squire, P.C. is reminding investors of class action lawsuits filed against Vestis, Reckitt, and Tempus, encouraging affected investors to reach out to discuss their options with Litigation Partner Brandon Walker.

items.summary: Map created by Newsweek shows the 10 wealthiest suburbs in America based on data provided by GOBankingRates for 2025.

items.title: Show HN: Myriade – Ask your database questions in plain English
items.summary: Myriade is a tool that allows users to ask questions to their database in plain English, making it easier to retrieve information. The creator was frustrated with the effort required to answer simple questions using SQL, prompting him to develop this solution.

items.title: Robots on the Jobsite: Why Construction Automation Is About Safety, Not Pink Slips
items.summary: Bedrock Robotics raised $80 million to retrofit construction equipment with AI for safety and to address labor shortages, not to eliminate jobs.

items.title: The many faces of crypto crime and the relentless cat-and-mouse chase
items.summary: Crypto crime is on the rise, leading to a cat-and-mouse chase between criminals and authorities. The article explores the different facets of crypto crime and the challenges faced in addressing this issue.

items.title: Embedding human rights into crypto isn’t optional, it’s foundational
items.summary: Embedding human rights into crypto systems is a necessity for digital freedom. Self-custody, privacy-by-default, and censorship-resistant personhood must be core design principles.

items.title: July 20 editorial cartoons
items.summary: Several political cartoons on July 20 touched on various ethical issues, such as the potential consequences of AI replacing human workers and attempts to distract from important news stories.

items.title: 3 Misleading AI Metaphors And One To Make It Right
items.summary: The article highlights three misleading AI metaphors and provides a better alternative to improve understanding of artificial intelligence. The focus is on how these metaphors can impact our perception of AI and its implications.

items.title: How old was your burglar? Hebrew University researchers can tell
items.summary: Hebrew University researchers have developed a method to accurately determine a person's age from small DNA samples, which could be helpful in forensic investigations. This innovation could revolutionize the field of DNA analysis and law enforcement.

items.title: In recent layoffs, AI's role may be bigger than companies are letting on
items.summary: In recent layoffs, companies may be downplaying the role of AI as a factor in job cuts by using terms like reorganization and restructuring. This raises ethical concerns about transparency and workers' understanding of the impact of automation on their jobs.
